org.medcare.igtl.network
Class SocketWriter

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.commons.net.SocketClient
      org.medcare.igtl.network.SocketWriter

public class SocketWriter
extends org.apache.commons.net.SocketClient

The class can be used by first connecting to a server using the SocketClient connect method. Then an InputStream and OutputStream for sending and receiving data over the Telnet connection can be obtained by using the getInputStream() and getOutputStream() methods. And a disconnect method to call disconnect rather than simply closing the streams.

Version:
0.1a (09/06/2010)
Author:
Andre Charles Legendre

Method Detail

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws java.io.IOException
Disconnects the socket session, closing the input streams as well as the socket. If you have references to the input streams of the socket connection, you should not close them yourself, but rather call disconnect to properly close the connection.

Overrides:
disconnect in class org.apache.commons.net.SocketClient
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getInputStream

public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
Returns the socket connection input stream. You should not close the stream when you finish with it. Rather, you should call disconnect .

Returns:
The socket connection input stream.

getOutputStream

public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
Returns the socket connection output stream. You should not close the stream when you finish with it. Rather, you should call disconnect .

Returns:
The socket connection output stream.

setReaderThread

public void setReaderThread(boolean flag)
Sets the status of the reader thread. The reader thread status will apply to all subsequent connections

Parameters:
flag - - true switches the reader thread on, false switches it off

getReaderThread

public boolean getReaderThread()
Gets the status of the reader thread.

Returns:
true if the reader thread is on, false otherwise
